Articles.Content: I have noticed a substantial performance increase with 0.21 vs. 0.20 . I have seen other comments stating that this is not the case for them. I would bet this is good to know for the developers if the majority of the users saw an increase or decrease in performance. I believe they were expecting an increase.

well sadly in my case was a decrease, 0.20 runned perfectly fine, no lag, never crashes and i could put a lot of mods, now in 0.21 my game crashes at random times or when enetering another body SOI and i have a bit longer loading times but luckily i still have no lag
Incredibly slow loading times, and full of bugs. 0.21 is unplayable for me.

Scene transition lasts a bit more than .20, and the space center scene is incredibly laggy.

Besides that, Everything's Ok.

I've noticed that the game seems to stutter a lot less now when trying to slow down physics calculations (making that delta time slider more effective). However, the long loading times are very annoying and sometimes even make the game crash.

Depends upon how you define performance; some stuff like physics warp works better for me, but I do see a lot more stutter in the audio and the loading times (for my near-vanilla installation, just Alarm Clock and ol' Boom-Boom installed) much longer.

-- Steve
bit slower, especially near celestial bodies. Otherwise about the same.

Even though i have a high-end system, my KSP in .21 has slowed down the transmission times from building to another a lot.

Any one now why does this happen?
Slower during autosaves and transitions from VAB to Pad or vice-versa.

Depends upon how you define performance; some stuff like physics warp works better for me, but I do see a lot more stutter in the audio and the loading times (for my near-vanilla installation, just Alarm Clock and ol' Boom-Boom installed) much longer.

-- Steve

Good question, I could have been more specific. My intended question had to do more with overall in-flight performance, and NOT LOAD TIMES etc. Even for me, my load times between buildings are noticeably faster by about a 10-20% margin. And before the 21.1 patch came out (while on 21.0), load times were very fast relatively.

FYI, everyone, I am still using an old Core2 duo XP machine with a GeForce 260, running native resolution on a 23" monitor, 4x AA, and most everything on high quality. My new i7 machine should be here any day now

Edited August 7, 2013 by roosterr

Overall decrease for me, and KSP had run perfectly fine before. Mainly the scene transitions, the space center, and I get a terrible lag going near any other body I haven't touched .21 since sometime after the release.
Clear performance decrease. Loading times are now from 5 to 10 seconds and the game runs slower especially around the ksc.
Seems about the same, apart from the much slower loading times, especially annoying when it kicks in when changing SOI.

A poll like this needs to be taken with a huge grain of salt. Perceptions of performance can differ greatly from what actual numbers would say, not to mention that a performance change could alter the likelihood that someone would participate in the poll (e.g., my framerate decreased and I have a bone to pick about it, vs. my framerate increased and I'm playing the game rather than browsing the forum).

I sometimes appear to have had a minor decrease, but it's hard to say if it's just my computer (maybe other programs are using more resources than normal or something) or if it's ksp itself. Most of the time it's not really noticable but sometimes when I play rockets that otherwise would have been fine seems to slow the game down to yellow-time (although not by much). Again I can't tell for sure yet that it's definitely the game rather than something else.

On my notebook - infamous long loading problem and major drop of FPS (everything worked smooth in 0.20)

On my gaming PC - also infamous long loading issue but when in comes to FPS game is smoother than in 0.20

And in both cases I have strange problem with performance in VAB/SPH - generally editor screens work smooth in beautiful 60 frames per second but when I look down directly onto the floor (or zoom out camera so far that I can see most of VAB/SPH floor). Boom! Sudden ridiculous FPS drop (from 60 to below 25...).

.20 for me was buggy, crashed constantly, and the physics was so bad I stopped playing the game because most everything feel apart on the launch pad. In .21 the performance problems nearly disappeared. Unfortunately, when transferring from one orbit to another the screen totally stops for several seconds then goes back to responding. Another issue is a framerate lock at 60. I have 120hz monitor and vsync (disabled or not) set to 120 always locks it at 60 in this version (.21).

Specs:

i7-3820 @ 4.8GHz

GTX680

16GB 2133mhz RAM

Samsung 840PRO SSD, etc. etc.
